refnamediv.refpurpose: store Store query output in a SciDB array

refsect1.title: Summary
refsect1.para: store is a write operator, that is, one of the AFL operations that can update an array. Each execution of store causes a new version of the array to be created. When an array is removed, so are all of its versions. The argument named_array must be an array that was previously created and stored in the SciDB namespace.

store() can be used to save the resultant output array into an existing/new array. It can also be used to duplicate an array (by using the name of the source array in the first parameter and target_array in the second parameter).

note.para: The AFL store operator provides the same functionality as the AQL SELECT * INTO ... FROM ... statement.

informalexample.para: Build and store a 2-dimensional, 1-attribute matrix of zeros: --afl store(build(<val: double>[i=0:2,3,0,j=0:2,3,0],0),zeros_array); --show-output=no --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes You can change the name of the array zeros_array to ones_array and the cell values to 1 with a store statement: --afl store(build(zeros_array,1),ones_array); --show-output=no --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes

Build and store a 2-dimensional, 1-attribute matrix of random numbers between 1 and 10: --afl CREATE ARRAY random_array <val:double null>[i=0:3,4,0,j=0:3,4,0]; --show-output=no --afl store(build(random_array,random()%10),random_array); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes --show-output-in-test-file=no You can update the array with a different set of random numbers by re-running the store statement: --afl store(build(random_array,random()%10),random_array); --output-format=dense --chunkify=yes --show-output-in-test-file=no
